intro: Weinmannia bulusanensis, commonly known as the Bulusan Weinmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cupressaceae. It is native to the Philippines, specifically found in the mountainous regions of the Bicol Peninsula. This evergreen shrub or small tree typically grows to a height of 3 to 5 meters. Its foliage consists of scale-like leaves that are dense and provide a compact appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by woody cones, typical of the conifer family.
